titleStmt.title: (Copy of) text concerning delivery of linenfor an Apis bull funeral

msContents.summary: Two priests in Bakchias write to six prieststhat they have brought linen for the funeral of an Apis bull.

msItem.note: Source of description: Recto; Verso blank
25 lines of cursive script along the fibres
Mentions Glaukias (son of Hermaiskos), Asklepiades, Sarapion, Hardbes and Pachtheinis

origin.origPlace: Bakchias, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome,province of Egypt

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt; Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

div.ab: Enclosure (?); To Glaukias, son ofHermaiskos and former gymnasiarch, to Asklepiades, deputy-gymnasiarch, to Sarapion, former chief-priest at the temple of Hadrian, to Hardbes, also called Apollonios, deputy of orapeia(?) and deputy head of the prophets and to the sacred scribes with them, ...., also called .... and Pachtheinis, also called Harimouthes.;Psenathtymis, son of Preiskos and priest at the Souchos temple in the village of Bakchias in the Arsinoite nome and ....is, son of Peteuris and priest at the Ammon temple of the same village, we two have, to the funeral and interment of the deified Apis, the offspring of Glameo, brought, on behalf of each of the above-mentioned temples, ..... cubits of linen.

listBibl.bibl: P.Lund. IV 9 SB VI 9346 BL III, 105 (lines 3, 25); BL V, 65 (line 4); BL IX, 155 (line 8); TM 11881; Gilliam, E. H., Yale Classical Studies 10, 1947, p. 181 ff; American Journal of Philology 70, 1949, p. 218 - 221; Taubenschlag, R., Journal of Juristic Papyri 3, 1949, p. 186
